fullText:
Two shows will be presented in Fall 2005: The Gay Life (October 18-30), with a score by Arthur Schwartz and Howard Dietz, concerns Anatol, a determined bachelor in turn-of-the century Vienna who eventually succumbs to the enchanting Liesl. Next up will be Good News (November 1-13), the Henderson, DeSylva & Brown romp about a football-obsessed collegian who falls for his tutor.

In Spring 2006, the company will present three shows, starting off with Jerome Kern and Otto Harbach’s Roberta (March 21-April 2), about an American man who inherits a Parisian dress shop and wisely seeks the assistance of a young woman of style and allure. It will be followed by Show Girl (April 25-May 7), a romanticization of the lives of aspiring theater people, with a score by George and Ira Gershwin and Gus Kahn. Set to close out the season is Let’s Face It (May 9-21), by Cole Porter and Dorothy and Herbert Fields, which concerns three suspicious wives who recruit three eager soldiers to help make their philandering husbands take notice of them.

For a subscription form, write to Musicals Tonight, 150 West 79th Street, Apt. 9A, New York, NY 10024. Single tickets will go on sale in September.

Review: Jason Alexander Leaves a Little Gristle in New Production of Sweeney Todd

Broadway performances start on March 27 at the Majestic Theatre.
dtliExcerpt: John Doyle's production of Sweeney Todd is nothing short of brilliant. By having the actors play their own instruments, he's created a chamber piece that's more intimate and perhaps more chilling than the original.
showScoreExcerpt: John Doyle's production of Sweeney Todd is nothing short of brilliant. By having the actors play their own instruments, he's created a chamber piece that's more intimate and perhaps more chilling than the original.

keyPhrases.quote: John Doyle's production of Sweeney Todd is nothing short of brilliant.

llmScore.reasoning: [ensemble-unanimous] | All 3 models agree: Rave | Claude: Unqualified praise calling the production 'brilliant' with no reservations. Enhanced praise comparing it favorably to the original as 'more intimate and perhaps more chilling.' | GPT-4o: The review uses strong, unqualified praise ('nothing short of brilliant') and highlights the innovative approach of the production, indicating a must-see recommendation. | Gemini: The review uses the word "brilliant," which indicates a rave review. The critic also praises the intimacy and chilling effect of the production.

rejectionReasoning: claude: This is a season announcement/promotional listing of upcoming shows with subscription information, not a review of any specific production; openai: This text is a listing of upcoming shows and promotional content, not a review of a specific Broadway production.; gemini: This is a listing of upcoming shows for a theater company, not a review of a specific production. It includes subscription information and other non-review content.; kimi: This text is a season announcement for Musicals Tonight containing plot summaries and subscription information for upcoming productions, with no critical evaluation or opinion of a specific show. It also includes promotional content and navigation links to other reviews.
